subclasses.name: animal_instinct
subclasses.description: The fury of a wild predator fills you when you Rage, granting you ferocious unarmed attacks. Cultures that revere vicious animals (such as apes or bears) give rise to barbarians with this instinct. You might also be at war with an uncontrollable, animalistic side of your personality, or you might be a descendant of a werewolf or another werecreature. Select an Animal Instincts that best matches your chosen animal.

subclass_feats.name: animal_instinct_anathema
subclass_feats.description: Flagrantly disrespecting an animal of your chosen kind is anathema to your instinct, as is using weapons while raging

subclass_feats.name: bestial_rage
subclass_feats.description: When you Rage, you gain your chosen animal’s unarmed attack (or attacks). The specific attack gained, the damage it deals, and its traits are listed. These attacks are in the brawling group. Your Rage action gains the morph, primal, and transmutation traits.

subclass_feats.name: animal_instinct_specialization_ability
subclass_feats.description: Increase the damage die size for the unarmed attacks granted by your chosen animal by one step, and increase the additional damage from Rage from 2 to 5 for your chosen animal’s unarmed attacks. The frog’s tongue attack and deer’s antler attack gain reach 10 feet. If you have greater weapon specialization, increase the damage from Rage from 5 to 12 for your chosen animal’s unarmed attacks.

subclass_feats.name: animal_instinct_raging_restistance
subclass_feats.description: You resist piercing and slashing damage

subclasses.name: dragon_instinct
subclasses.description: You summon the fury of a mighty dragon and manifestincredible abilities. Perhaps your culture reveres draconicmajesty, or you gained insights by drinking or bathing indragon’s blood or watching a marauding wyrm burn your village. Select a type of Dragon Instincts as your instinct’s dragon type. Chromatic dragons tend to be evil, and metallic dragons tend to be good.

choices.name: dragon_instincts_black
choices.description: Category: Chromatic, Breath Weapon: Line of Acid

choices.name: dragon_instincts_blue
choices.description: Category: Chromatic, Breath Weapon: Line of Electricity

choices.name: dragon_instincts_green
choices.description: Category: Chromatic, Breath Weapon: Cone of Poison

choices.name: dragon_instincts_red
choices.description: Category: Chromatic, Breath Weapon: Cone of Fire

choices.name: dragon_instincts_white
choices.description: Category: Chromatic, Breath Weapon: Cone of Cold

choices.name: dragon_instincts_brass
choices.description: Category: Metallic, Breath Weapon: Line of Fire

choices.name: dragon_instincts_bronze
choices.description: Category: Metallic, Breath Weapon: Line of Electricity

choices.name: dragon_instincts_copper
choices.description: Category: Metallic, Breath Weapon: Line of Acid

choices.name: dragon_instincts_gold
choices.description: Category: Metallic, Breath Weapon: Cone of Fire

choices.name: dragon_instincts_silver
choices.description: Category: Metallic, Breath Weapon: Cone of Cold

subclass_feats.name: dragon_instinct_anathema
subclass_feats.description: Letting a personal insult against you slide is anathema toyour instinct. Choose whether your character respects orabhors your dragon type. If you respect it, defying such adragon is anathema, and if you abhor it, failing to defeatsuch a dragon you come across is anathema.

subclass_feats.name: draconic_rage
subclass_feats.description: While raging, you can increase the additional damage from Rage from 2 to 4 and change its damage type to match that of your dragon’s breath weapon instead of the damage type for your weapon or unarmed attack. If you do this, your Rage action gains the arcane and evocation traits, as well as the trait matching the damage type.

subclass_feats.name: dragon_instinct_specialization_ability
subclass_feats.description: When you use draconic rage, you increase the additional damage from Rage from 4 to 8. If you have greater weapon specialization, instead increase the damage from Rage when using draconic rage from 8 to 16.

subclass_feats.name: dragon_instinct_raging_resistance
subclass_feats.description: You resist piercing damage and the damage type of your dragon’s breath weapon.

subclasses.name: fury_instinct
subclasses.description: Your rage comes from a deep and purely personal well within you. You use your rage as you choose.

subclass_feats.name: fury_instinct_specialization_ability
subclass_feats.description: Increase the additional damage from Rage from 2 to 6. If you have greater weapon specialization, instead increase the additional damage from Rage to 12.

subclass_feats.name: fury_instinct_raging_resistance
subclass_feats.description: You resist physical weapon damage, but not physicaldamage from other sources (such as unarmed attacks).

subclasses.name: giant_instinct
subclasses.description: Your rage gives you the raw power and size of a giant. This doesn’t necessarily mean you revere giants—you might scoff at them or even aspire to slay them! You could instead seem like a giant to other people due to your exceptional strength or larger-than-life emotions and ego.

subclass_feats.name: titan_instinct_anathema
subclass_feats.description: Failing to face a personal challenge of strength is anathema.

subclass_feats.name: titan_mauler
subclass_feats.description: You can use a weapon built for a Large creature if you are Small or Medium (both normally and when raging). If you’re not Small or Medium, you can use a weapon built for a creature one size larger than you. You gain access to this larger weapon, which can be of any weapon type otherwise available at character creation. It has the normal Price and Bulk for a weapon of its size (page 295). When wielding such a weapon in combat, increase your additional damage from Rage from 2 to 6, but you have the clumsy 1 condition (page 618) because of the weapon’s unwieldy size. You can’t remove this clumsy condition or ignore its penalties by anymeans while wielding the weapon

subclass_feats.name: giant_instinct_specialization_ability
subclass_feats.description: Increase the damage from Rage when using a larger weapon from 6 to 10; if you have greater weapon specialization, increase it from 10 to 18.

subclass_feats.name: giant_instinct_raging_resistance
subclass_feats.description: You resist bludgeoning damage and your choice of cold, electricity, or fire, chosen when you gain raging resistance.

subclasses.name: spirit_instinct
subclasses.description: Whether you are emotionally sensitive to the spirits around you; worship ancestors or apparitions; or are haunted by the specter of an ancestor, relative, friend, or foe, your rage takes the form of a spiritual possession.

class_feats.name: spirit_instinct_anathema
class_feats.description: Disrespecting corpses or spirits is anathema to your instinct; defending yourself against undead creatures is not.

class_feats.name: spirit_rage
class_feats.description: While raging, you can increase the additional damage from Rage from 2 to 3 and change its damage type to negative or positive, instead of the damage type for your weapon or unarmed attack (choose each time you Rage). If you choose to deal negative or positive damage, your weapon or unarmed attack gains the effects of the ghost touch property rune, which makes it more effective against incorporeal creatures, and your Rage action gains the divine and necromancy traits, plus negative or positive, as appropriate.

class_feats.name: spirit_instinct_specialization_ability
class_feats.description: When using spirit rage, increase the damage from Rage from 3 to 7. If you have greater weapon specialization, instead increase the damage when using spirit rage to 13.

class_feats.name: spirit_instinct_raging_resistance
class_feats.description: You resist negative damage, as well as damage dealt by the attacks and abilities of undead creatures, regardless of the damage type.
